results.authors: By Rachel Gamarski and Dinesh Nair
results.headline: International Paper Seeks to Reassure DS as Suzano Plots Bid
results.summary: International Paper Co.’s top boss traveled to London to reaffirm his company’s commitment to merger partner DS Smith Plc, downplaying a takeover offer from Suzano SA that threatens to derail their pending £5.8 billion ($7.4 billion) deal, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

results.authors: By Martha Viotti Beck and Simone Iglesias
results.headline: Former Brazil Finance Chief Says He Was Sought for Braskem
results.summary: Former Brazil Finance Minister Guido Mantega said President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government sought him for a spot on the board of Braskem SA, and he will accept the job if shareholders approve.

results.authors: By Martha Viotti Beck, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo, and Rachel Gamarski
results.headline: Lula Wants Strings Attached to Brazil’s Rescue Plan for Airlines
results.summary: Brazil’s government has presented its aid plan for the airline industry to the three largest players in the country with an announcement expected in the second half of the year, according to people familiar with the matter.

results.headline: Telecom Italia CEO Says Grid Deal Frees Firm for Future M&A
results.summary: Telecom Italia SpA will be ready for new deals after it completes its landmark €22 billion ($23.8 billion) network selloff, a move aimed at freeing the carrier from billions of euros in debt.

results.authors: By Srinivasan Sivabalan and Selcuk Gokoluk
results.headline: Sinking Profits Bring Reality Check to AI-Driven Rally in Emerging Market Stocks
results.summary: Just as enthusiasm over artificial intelligence and China’s stimulus fades, a familiar weakness has come back to haunt equity investors in emerging markets: sinking corporate profits.

results.authors: By Maria Eloisa Capurro and Matthew Malinowski
results.headline: Brazil Analysts Hike Forecasts for Interest Rate and Inflation
results.summary: Brazil analysts raised their interest rate forecasts for this year and next as they also see faster inflation through 2026, indicating the outlook for Latin America’s largest economy continues to worsen.

results.headline: French Luxury Hotelier Thierry Teyssier Says Hospitality Has it All Wrong
results.summary: If tourism is going to make the planet better, argues Thierry Teyssier, it has to stop putting guests’ needs first.

results.authors: By Philip Heijmans, Peter Martin, and Josh Xiao
results.headline: Competing US-China Defense Tactics Dominate Singapore Forum
results.summary: Global defense leaders descending on Singapore this weekend confronted conflicting visions of the region: the US touted expanding military exercises and partnerships across the Indo-Pacific, while China criticized “outside forces” for interfering with peace and stability.

results.headline: Central Banks Latest: World Rate Paths Set to Diverge With ECB’s First Cut
results.summary: The European Central Bank could open the door to a weaker euro on Thursday as its first interest-rate cut of the cycle puts the region on a divergent policy path from the US.

results.authors: By Philip Heijmans and Alfred Cang
results.headline: Zelenskiy Accuses China of Undermining Ukraine Summit
results.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy accused Beijing of working with Moscow to undermine a summit to discuss his country’s peace blueprint, in a sign of growing frustration with China’s deepening ties with Russia.
